name: Two-Column Narrative
description: Standard body text layout split into two equal columns for dense narrative sections, reducing line length for improved readability on A4 pages. Used for extended prose sections like methodology descriptions, detailed analysis, or background context.

grid.columns: 1-16 (full-width container), internally split into 1-8 and 9-16 (two 8-column halves)

components: PatternBlock(two-col-narrative) as root container with CSS columns or grid
Section heading: $heading-04 in $text-01, spans full width above both columns
Body paragraphs: $body-long-02 in $text-01, flowing across two columns
Drop cap (optional): first letter of first paragraph in $display-01 $blue-60, 3 lines tall
Inline subheadings: $heading-03 in $text-01, column-spanning or inline
Column divider: optional 1px $ui-03 vertical rule between columns
Footnote markers: superscript $label-01 for endnote references
rules: Two columns only for body text — never split structured elements (tables, charts, KPIs) across columns
Column gap must be $spacing-07 (32px) minimum — tighter gaps make columns bleed into each other visually
Body text uses $body-long-02 (16px/24px) — the larger body scale compensates for narrower column width
Section headings span full width above both columns — never place a heading inside a single column
Paragraphs should not break with fewer than 3 lines in either column (orphan/widow control)
Use column-fill: balance to equalize column heights — uneven columns look like a layout error
Drop cap, if used, only on the first paragraph of a major section — never on every paragraph
This pattern works best for 3+ consecutive paragraphs — shorter content doesn't justify the two-column treatment

printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — content stays within column bounds
printBehavior.orphanWidowControl: minimum 3 lines per column at page breaks

accessibilityNotes: CSS columns linearize correctly for screen readers — no special markup needed for reading order
Drop cap must not be an empty decorative element — keep the letter in the text flow with CSS :first-letter
Column divider (vertical rule) must have aria-hidden='true' — purely decorative
Ensure footnote superscripts link to endnotes via <a href='#fn-N'> for keyboard accessibility
antiPatterns: Never split tables, charts, or structured blocks across two columns — these elements need full-width or dedicated column spans
Never use two-column layout for fewer than 3 paragraphs — it looks forced and wastes the pattern's purpose
Never use $body-long-01 (14px) in narrow columns — the reduced column width requires the larger $body-long-02 scale
Never let column heights differ by more than 3 lines — unbalanced columns signal poor layout automation
Never stack two-column sections back-to-back without a full-width break element (heading, figure, or quote) between them
